chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)
Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jorge L Torres Aparicio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court IMPOSES & STAYS 8 YEARS PRISON with 3 years initial confinement and 5 years extended supervision and places the Defendant on probation for 5 years.

records.addlTxt: Court's response to Defendant's letter received 6/17/2016 - The issues discussed in this letter are completely within the discretion of the Sheriff, not the court.
Transcript of 2/9/16 Plea and Sentencing Hearing

Case called at 11:11 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jorge L Torres Aparicio in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court AMENDS Count #1 to reflect a violation (between 6/19/15 - 6/22/15 in the City of Fort Atkinson) of 948.02(2) Wis. Stats a Class C Felony. 

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

The Court IMPOSES & STAYS 8 YEARS PRISON with 3 years initial confinement and 5 years extended supervision and places the Defendant on probation for 5 years, with conditions:
--Serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence 2/19/16 by 6:00 pm
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--Sex offender assessment & follow through with all treatment recommendations
--Sex offender registry
--No possession of any Smart Phone, computer or other computerized device capable of accessing the internet, except as authorized by Agent for purposes of employment, education or counseling
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--No contact with RMG (dob: 8/19/1999) or any female under the age of 18
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay $76 subpeona fees

If revoked, the Court finds that Mr. Aparicio is NOT eligible for Callenge Incareceration Program or Substance Abuse Program

Days credit for time already served: 1 day
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 11:45 am

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 8:37am [mo]
[Scheduled for Plea Hearing]
Defendant Jorge L Torres Aparicio in court with Attorney Brian Severson.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

On the Defendant's Motion to Withdraw as Counsel:
--Arguments given by Atty. Severson
--Questioning by the Court
--Statement made by Mr. Torres-Aparicio

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling; counsel agree 2 day trial needed.
The Court directs Mr. Torres-Aparicio to go to the Jefferson SPD office today.
The Court notifies Mr. Torres-Aparicio that if he arrives at the FSSC hearing without counsel, he may forfeit his right to counsel.
The Court directs Mr. Torres-Aparicio to write a letter to the court shall he not have an attorney appointed by next week.

The Court signs the proposed Motion and Order to Withdraw.
The Court reminds Mr. Torres-Aparicio that his bond and its conditions remain in effect. 

recess:8:54am

NEXT: (1)FSSC on 2/9/16 at 10:30am (2)Jury Trial on 2/15 AND 2/16/16 at 8:30am

Case called at 1:35pm [mo]
Defendant Jorge L Torres Aparicio in court with Attorney Brian Severson.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Severson indicates that an evaluation is in the process; requests a Plea/Sentencing date.
--ADA Shock agrees that a Plea Hearing in January is appropriate

The Court does not schedule the Sentencing at this time as unsure whether the State is requesting a PSI be conducted, the Court also indicates that there is ample time on the scheduled date to conduct the Sentencing hearing also, as needed.
recess: 1:38pm
NEXT: Plea Hearing on 1/7/2016 at 8:30am

Case called at 11:35 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Jorge L Torres Aparicio in court with Attorney Brian Severson. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Severson: Requests STC in approx. 60 days, presents basis including expert witness evaluation - have received confirmation that she will need 30 - 45 days to conduct an evaluation and produce a report. Then would need time to review with client and the State
ADA Hall: No objection, victim rights compliance verified
Recess: 11:38 am 

NEXT:  Schedule STC 11/24/15 at 1:30 pm - Send notices

Case called at 8:32 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Mark A. Frankel presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Jorge L Torres Aparicio in court with Attorney Brian Severson.  ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Aparicio  waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending; confirms address on file is accurate
Atty Severson request hearings be set out a bit due to amt. of scheduling - No objection from State
Recess: 8:41 am 

NEXT: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 9/9/15 at 1:40 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 10/2/15 at 11:00 am - Send notices
Attorney Severson for Attorney De La Rosa
Proposed order for substitution of attorney
Original Bond received from JESO on 7/30/15

case called at 1:17pm. [mo]
[Commissioner Fremgen presiding for Branch II Intake]
Defendant Jorge L Torres Aparicio appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Svehlek indicates that Mr. Torres- Aparicio is eligible for PD representation.
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are not waived by the Defense

The Court requires a $5,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--No Contact with R.M.G. or her residence
--Not have un-supervised physical contact with any female under the age of 18
--No presence at any schools
--No coaching activities with any minor children under the age of 18
--Not to leave the State of Wisconsin
recess 1:28  pm. 


NEXT: Preliminary Hearing: 8/14/15 at 8:30am
